reviews.review: Very intresting game. I can't wait for Half- Life 2: Episode Three..
Для этого эпизода есть классные моды, да не просто какие-то там изменения в оригинале, а самостоятельные качественные игры.

The cliffhanger to the Half Life 2 franchise!

So if you read my previous review, its preety much like that, albeit at a more open scale. Much of the game is spen on a road rip to a Military base. The action set pieces are phenomonal ( Fighting wih the Vorts against the Antlions was spectacular! And the ending battle was really tense!)

So chances are if you have Half Life 2, then you already own thse expanions. They are worthy additions, and should keep you busy. Even if you didn't like the original Half life 2 ( HEATHEN!), I found that the episodes were in diffrent tone ( Episode 1 is more Escape the City/ Last Stand against the combine) while Episode 2 was ( Road Trip Nature Trek with Dangerous Creatures Advenure)

So in other words, its great. SHort, but great. Whatever, you probably payed 5 cents for it at this point.
My favorite chapter so far in the Half-Life saga.  Just wish it was longer!

Si escapar de Ciudad 17 ya te costó lo tuyo no solo por los enemigos sino por la cuenta atrás que tenías... ¡ESPERA LO QUE TIENE LA ALIANZA RESERVADO PARA TI EN LOS BOSQUES DE CIUDAD 17! En este episodio si que se ha introducido la alta calidad del HDR en el motor Source comparable con la de Half-Life 2: Lost Coast. Llega a White Forest con tu compañera Alyx para encontrarte con Eli Vance tal y como quedastéis en el Episodio 1. Lo más destacable del juego son los paisajes al aire libre y el capítulo dedicado íntegramente a las cuevas de las hormigas león donde tienes la máxima potencia del HDR y las grandes mejoras que ha sufrido Source con el también motor físico Havok (Escena de derrumbe del puente de la vía). Totalmente recomendado.
I spent 6.9 hours because I savored it, you should too!
STILL WAITING FOR EPISODE 3 VALVE

The best of what Half Life has to offer. I'm not the biggest Half Life 2 game, but I believe it's worth playing through the series to enjoy this gem. Nothing in EP2 is revolutionary, but it's a great display of how a game can be when everything is done right.

Like the first game, Half-Life 2 is an FPS revered not primarily for its gameplay, but for its presentation first and foremost. The structure of the game with its dialogue (which would be in cutscenes in modern day games, here you retain control over your character), characters, scripted events, and world building. In these regards it's a step up over its predecessor.

It's also a bit of a step up with its "puzzle" gameplay, which is really solving practical puzzles often with the aid of physics. The physics emphasis is greater in Half-Life 2 as it's a technological showcase in that regard, although these "puzzles" overall aren't the best of their kind.

As an actual FPS, Half-Life 2 largely omits the low resource, more survival oriented portions of the first game, and has vehicle sections instead. Both games have a bit more gameplay variety than the average shooter, with Half-Life 2 having claustrophobic CQB, larger scale outdoor gunfights, gunfights with allies so it's not just you, vehicle sections, some verticality. Again it isn't top tier in its diversity here, where Unreal is crowned, but it is adequate.

But compared to the first game, Half-Life 2 makes sacrifices to weapon diversity and most of all enemy diversity. For weapon diversity, Half-Life 2 is just average although one piece of equipment really aids it here, and that's the Gravity Gun being one of the coolest FPS weapon inventions ever. It lacks the more alien or higher tech Sci-Fi weapon design beyond this, although the first game's Hive-Hand is quite useless so not much is lost there. The trip mines were also quite useless. The satchel charges might be nice but aren't a requirement. 

And unlike the first game, every weapon retains some degree of usefulness here. The crowbar is always good against headcrabs, the pistol is always good for weaker enemies where you want to conserve ammo due to the SMG's inaccuracy. Every weapon has its use here, even if weapon design isn't brilliant overall.

A bit more cleverness went into the level design of the first game. Route Kanal has some questionable, useless areas, Half-Life was weak when it came to having secret areas/pickups on levels but Half-Life 2 doesn't even try here, there's no real brilliance in any of its level design and NPCs can sometimes struggle to navigate it.

The levels are also artistically outdated. Half-Life 2 is mostly set in outdoor locations but there are often very obvious voids in out of bound areas, or very obvious low quality filler models and textures just outside of the playable area. The outdoor maps never feel like real places and instead they always feel like old FPS video game maps, a weakness Half-Life doesn't have. Thankfully Cinematic Mod remedies this for Half-Life 2.

As everybody knows by now, Half-Life 2 and Source Engine in general retains the awkward, clunky slidey movement from GoldSource, but you're even floatier now. The lack of movement precision and responsiveness along with the ability to get stuck on light physics objects ensures that Half-Life 2 gameplay never flows particularly smoothly. You're slipping and sliding around and engaging in overall mediocre combat design.

Ultimately this is a solid game that, like its predecessor, is overrated considering the most loved thing about it is really its presentation. But it does craft a cool dystopian future with memorable characters, the Gravity Gun, and some fun physics related gameplay even if it never reaches the brilliance of some later games in this regard (like FEAR, Dark Messiah, and Crysis). 

Episode 1 is more of the same from Half-Life 2, a necessary expansion to the story with no gameplay improvements or decline. Episode 2 has slightly better combat encounters and introduces Hunters and Advisors which are nice to have.

I highly recommend anyone playing this game, first time or no, to use MMod 1.3 + Cinematic Mod 2013. This merge keeps the unwanted Cinematic Mod features out of the game and keeps its excellent graphics and artistic level design improvements, and MMod makes undeniably superior gameplay enhancements and is very configurable.

[h3]Strengths[/h3]
[list]
[*]Highly physics enabled world

[*]Interesting dystopian future setting with some memorable characters

[*]The Gravity Gun is one of the coolest weapons ever designed

[*]AI is advanced, albeit held back a bit too much

[*]Moderately diverse gameplay for an FPS

[*]Super moddable with some incredible mods, plus strong options configuration and a powerful console/terminal
[/list]

[h3]Weaknesses[/h3]
[list]
[*]Floaty, slidey movement doesn't feel good and lacks precision especially since you can get stuck on light physics objects, ladders are unreliable as is jumping out of water

[*]Enemy variety is lacking, even compared to the first game which isn't excellent here

[*]Weapon diversity is lacking overall

[*]Weapon switching was always unnecessarily clunky with its two-step process design. It only binds weapons to the 1-5 keys so you will have many weapons bound to one key. To switch, you press the key up to several times depending on the weapon you want to select, and then press LMB, opposed to the classic "press one key to equip a weapon" or weapon wheel designs which are much faster and more efficient.

[*]Player weapon accuracy is too poor considering how aimbotty and spongey Combine are, the lack of good cover shooter mechanics for those sections (leaning, iron sights), and the lack of any skill curve and creative design to weapons besides the gravity gun. Just pray and spray. Not unlike the first game though weapons are even less accurate here, further cementing Half-Life 2's FPS gameplay as just mediocre.

[*]Weapons feel ineffectual due to no recoil (fake recoil, no actual change in dispersion or muzzle climb when spamming the two full auto guns) and bullet spongey enemies who are not reactive to shots. You'll just be mag dumping them with the SMG or even pulse rifle while they stand there taking it, not trying to avoid your shots and not flinching or reacting to them in any meaningful way. Compare this to actual challenging battles with responsive guns and enemies in games like Unreal and Doom and Quake and even Turok 2, and it's really bad.

[*]Frag grenade throwing arc is awkward and not ideal

[*]Gravity Gun can't be used to force open doors

[*]The AI is better than it appears in-game due to some restrictions which make the game too easy

[*]AI, especially Combine, will sometimes brain fart at close range and not do anything, and their movement in combat is extremely limited. They always rush you making them very predictable, and they generally don't care to take cover. They will stand out in the open hosing you down while being hosed down, not really reacting to your shots.

[*]Combine AI is grenade spammy to the point where they just frag themselves and take care of much of the work for you

[*]Level design is lacking in detail and sorely lacking in secrets and never achieves brilliance. You almost always feel like you're just in dated video game maps in Half-Life 2, unlike in the first game.

[*]Maps appear visually unfinished with obvious voids or throwaway textures and models right outside of the playable area (fixed by Cinematic Mod)

[*]Still encourages some degree of cover shooting, even if not as much as the first game, yet has no leaning or iron sights

[*]Surround spatialization is bad and uneven

[*]Long in-game loading times

[*]Obviously a minor complaint but breakable crates not containing pickups are totally empty, whereas in the first game they at least had junk items/props in them
[/list]

Another content expansion in the world of Half-Life 2, this one brings us to the quest of Gordon Freeman after he has successfully begun the uprising, saw to its fruition, and now must ensure that it bears fruit. The fate of humanity rests on one M.I.T. professor with a P.HD in Theoretical Physics and "I'm going to kick your f****** ass".

Once again, the content expansion is incredible, and the change in scenery is both refreshing and intensifying. Not onlyt hat, but a good slew of new content, a great ride, character development, enemy additions, and probably one of the deeper segments in the entire series rests with thsi expansion.

Unlike the prior expansion, I feel that Episode Two is A MUST for the Half-Life experience. Questions are answered, many more are posed, and it sets us up for the culmination of the Half-Life 2 journey, Episode Three, which 'I believe may be as important even so thatn HL2 itself.

Best in the series by far, Gorden’s owner Alyx gets some down time so Gordon gets to drive a fast car around running over zombies and carry around a garden gnome and sending it to space, Riding mine carts.

Еще более увлекательный геймплей, похорошевшая графика и сюжет, обрывающийся на самом интересном месте. Тот, кто хоть немного поиграет в этот эпизод, не сможет остаться равнодушным ко вселенной Half-Life и присоединится к огромной армии фанатов.

Half-Life 2
Clássico game FPS em que você encarna o Rebelde Gordon Freeman (deve ser parente do Morgan Freemam), claro que o jogo não tem os melhores graficos do mundo (tbm nao sao os piores) mas em compensação tem uma história de arrasar quarteirão, nele vc enfrenta o governo, zumbis e aliens (vish) e alem de muita bala voando, não pense que o jogo é moleza, vc vai se deparar com muitos enigmas super tensos e complexos, um game de ação rapida e jogabilidade muito fluida, garante boa diversão e muitos sustos tbm (eu que o diga). O game Half-Life 2 ja tem 3 expanções oficiais que complementam a história do jogo, aconselho fortemente jogarem o primeiro jogo da série ou vao ficar totalmente perdidos na história.  cada segundo de download é recompensado com 50~100 horas de gameplay intenso.
Nota: SS+ [Imperdível]

The Half Life 2 saga is easily one of the most unforgettable FPS experiences ever. While maybe there IS something or another lacking, Valve has managed to make a game with pacing so perfectly planned and fluid that it'll keep you on your toes from as soon as you pick up the can up until you need to hold all those striders trying to reach the launch base. Epic levels such as Ravenholme and the antlion tunnels (with the epic Vortal Combat music playing on the background) and THAT moment on EP2 that made the whole world beg Gabe to give us the third episode. It's impressive how an unpretentious game such as the original Half Life would turn out to be remodeled not only to showcase Valve's "new" (it was back then) engine, but to stand among the legends of gaming.
Достойное продолжение первому эпизоду и Half-Life 2 в целом! В общем-то много хвалить игру нет смысла ибо ни один фанат Half-Life мимо ее все равно не пройдет :)

Ein weiteres geniales Kapitel der Half Life Serie! Anfangs wirkt das Spiel sehr begrenzt, da man nur in Höhlen ist und gegen Zombies und Ameisenlöwen kämpft. Jedoch wenn man dann an die Oberfläche fährt und mit dem Auto rumfährt kommt das echte Half Life Gefühl wieder. In Episode 2 gibt es unglaublich viele packende Szenen. Beispielsweise die Schlacht mit den Vortigaunts, der Auftritt des G-Mans und das geniale Ende. Eins fehlt nur noch an dem Spiel und zwar der Nachfolger: Half Life 2 Episode 3!!!

It's again a great continuation of the series but I've really gotta say... The ending really pisses me off. Especially knowing this game was made about six years ago. C'mon Valve I know that you've been busy with Left 4 Dead and Portal but seriously listen to your fans they want Half-Life 3 already!

Пройдя Half-Life 2 : Episode Two , а соответственно и пока что последнюю часть истории Лалфы , стало немного даже грустно и печально , поскольку настолько все реально , что привязываешься к персонажем этой невероятной истории как к живым. Wow. Episode 2 picks up where episode one finished, and noticeably improves on episode one. Action packed with a gripping story and filled with interesting puzzles, Episode 2 is definitely a game for everyone who's played Half Life 2. The game feels, perhaps, even more epic than even Half Life 2 itself. Perhaps the only downside of Episode 2 is the fact that Episode 3 isn't out yet (as of January 2012) and after you've finished episode 2, you'll be wanting episode 3...

Ни одну игру я не ценю так как Half-life 2 с её эпизодами.Есть в ней что-то задевающее за душу.Казалось бы : что особенного?Ходим по шахтам,затем по лесу,затем едем по лесу....Но поиграв в неё вы поймёте,о чём я тут пишу...Также как Half-life 2 и  Episode 1,эта часть вас не разочарует,а вконце даже опечалит кое-каким "происшествием".В общем,если вас заинтересовало то,что я описал выше - покупайте Half-life 2 и все её эпизоды.И,если кто-то из Steam читает это,то передайте пожалуйста Гейбу Ньюэллу,что было бы неплохо выпустить третий эпизод до конца света.Спасибо.
